intro: Dodonaea viscosa var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hop萧, is a shrub native to Australia. It features small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers clustered in spikes, which are typically followed by red, fleshy berries. It is adapted to arid and coastal environments, showcasing drought tolerance and salt resistance. Its rapid growth and hardy nature make it a common species in various ecological and horticultural settings.
